org.neuroph.contrib.neat.gen
Class Innovations

java.lang.Object
  org.neuroph.contrib.neat.gen.Innovations
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class Innovations
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

The Innovations is a simple class that monitors the creation of ConnectionGene and NeuronGenes as part of the evolution process. If a Gene is attempted to be added by one of the MutationOperators then this class is first checked to see if the mutation was tried before. If it was tried before then the old Gene is retrieved from this class and used instead of creating a new Gene.

Author:
Aidan Morgan
See Also:

Method Detail

calculateAdded

public static Innovations calculateAdded(Innovations base,
                                         Innovations current)
Convenience method that will create a new Innovations that only contains the elements that are in current and not in base.

Parameters:
base - the Innovations to use as the base model, all elements in this Innovations will NOT be present in the returned Innovations.
current - the Innovations to check for new entries (i.e. entries that are not in the base Innovations map.
Returns:
a new Innovations instance that contains only the entries that have been added to current in comparison to base.

getConnectionGene

public ConnectionGene getConnectionGene(long originId,
                                        long endpointId)
Retrieves a ConnectionGene connecting the two provided neuron id's, null if no connection has been created before.

Parameters:
originId - the id of the neuron the connection is starting at.
endpointId - the id of the neuron the connection is ending at.
Returns:
a ConnectionGene connecting the two provided neuron id's, null if no connection has been created before.

cg - the ConnectionGene to store.

getNeuronGene

public NeuronGene getNeuronGene(long connectionId)
Retrieves a NeuronGene that would be created by splitting the connection with the provided connection id, null if no NeuronGene was created before.

Parameters:
connectionId - the id of the ConnectionGene to be split for creating the NeuronGene.
Returns:
a NeuronGene that would be created by splitting the connection with the provided connection id, null if no NeuronGene was created before.

putNeuronGene

public void putNeuronGene(long connectionId,
                          NeuronGene ng)
Stores the NeuronGene in this Innovations. A NeuronGene innovation requires the id of the connection that was split in order to create it. The add neuron mutation operation initially identifies a connection, and then splits it into two connections, adding a neuron in the middle. The connectionId parameter is the id of the connection that was split (and subsequently removed) for the provided NeuronGene to be inserted.

Parameters:
connectionId - the id of the connection that was split (and subsequently removed) for the provided NeuronGene to be inserted.
ng - the NeuronGene that was inserted.

getConnectionInnovationForNeuron

public long getConnectionInnovationForNeuron(NeuronGene ng)
Returns the innovation id of the ConnectionGene that was split when the provided NeuronGene was added to the Organism.

Parameters:
ng - the NeuronGene to find the associated split ConnectionGene for.
Returns:
the innovation id of the ConnectionGene that was split when the provided NeuronGene was added to the Organism.
